dt: {bc}quartz that is transparent or nearly so and that is either colorless or only slightly tinged
{bc}something resembling crystal in transparency and colorlessness
{bc}a body that is formed by the solidification of a chemical element, a compound, or a mixture and has a regularly repeating internal arrangement of its atoms and often external plane faces
{bc}a clear colorless glass of superior quality
{bc}the glass or transparent plastic cover over a watch or clock dial
{bc}a {a_link|crystalline} material used in electronics as a frequency-determining element or for rectification
{bc}methamphetamine in any form when used illicitly

et: Middle English {it}cristal{/it} "transparent quartz, object made from it," borrowed from Anglo-French, borrowed from Latin {it}crystallum, crystallus, crustallum{/it} "clear ice, rock crystal," borrowed from Greek {it}krýstallos,{/it} probably borrowed from a pre-Greek substratum; replacing Old English {it}cristalla, cristal, cristallum,{/it} borrowed from Latin {it}crystallum{/it}

Greek {it}krýstallos{/it} was traditionally linked etymologically with {it}krýos{/it} "icy cold, frost" and Latin {it}crusta{/it} "hard surface layer," though the morphological details were not explicable (and {it}crusta{/it} does not refer to ice or cold). More likely, as asserted by Robert Beekes ({it}Etymological Dictionary of Greek{/it} [Leiden: Brill, 2010], p. 787), {it}krýstallos,{/it} as evidenced by the suffix {it}-allos{/it} (from {it}*al{sup}y{/sup}-{/it} according to Beekes) and the variant {it}króstallos,{/it} is of pre-Greek origin. Cf. notes at {et_link|cryo-|cryo-}, {et_link|crust|crust}.
shortdef: quartz that is transparent or nearly so and that is either colorless or only slightly tinged
something resembling crystal in transparency and colorlessness
a body that is formed by the solidification of a chemical element, a compound, or a mixture and has a regularly repeating internal arrangement of its atoms and often external plane faces

dt: {bc}an organic liquid whose physical properties resemble those of a crystal in the formation of loosely ordered molecular arrays similar to a regular crystalline lattice and the anisotropic refraction of light

shortdef: an organic liquid whose physical properties resemble those of a crystal in the formation of loosely ordered molecular arrays similar to a regular crystalline lattice and the anisotropic refraction of light
